high.interpretations: Reflects high cardiovascular exertion, suitable for intense conditioning.
recommendations: Incorporate interval training to manage heart rate.
Use tempo runs and controlled breathing to improve endurance.

normal.interpretations: Balanced conditioning, supporting consistent sprint performance.
recommendations: Maintain aerobic and sprint training.
Occasional cadence drills.
Increase sprint intensity and review recovery practices.
Use active recovery methods like light jogging.

high.interpretations: Strong leg turnover, indicating readiness for explosive activities.
recommendations: Maintain high cadence and consider agility drills.
Focus on high-knee drills and form refinement.

underweight.interpretations: Below recommended weight, may affect muscle mass.
recommendations: Focus on a balanced diet rich in proteins.
Emphasize strength training.

normal.interpretations: Healthy weight range, supporting agility and endurance.
recommendations: Maintain a balanced diet and combine strength and cardio workouts.
Adopt balanced diet focusing on portion control.
Focus on low-impact cardio.

obese.interpretations: High weight, may hinder performance and increase injury risk.
recommendations: Prioritize a calorie-controlled diet.
Start with low-impact activities.

high.interpretations: May suggest excessive reliance on the forefoot.
recommendations: Focus on balanced push-off mechanics.
Strengthen toe flexors and improve push-off power.

high.interpretations: Indicates heel-strike tendency, can slow down acceleration.
recommendations: Focus on midfoot or forefoot strike techniques.
Improve heel engagement through posture correction.

good.interpretations: Long stride length, indicating good flexibility and power.
recommendations: Maintain flexibility and power-focused training.

bad.interpretations: Short stride may reduce sprint speed.
recommendations: Increase hip flexibility and strengthen leg muscles.
